addressleaf.section:
To M
r
Depute at Middel
b
July 29 1592

page.lettertext:
fol.260r
Belgia 1592 29 July To the Debuty at Midelborough
S
r
. suche is my busines, w
ch
increaseth every day,
at I can
not answear as I would, nor so soone altogether, as yow
may happely espect, upon
e l
re
s of
e
Company
. But I
have receaved their l
re
s, and yours, w
t
all
e schedules
thereinclosed, and to shewe you mine opinion, For as much
as among
e Articles sette downe between you and the
marchants heere, there were some of them accorded,
some rejected, some c
o
tinued by provision, and some re-
fered to
e
States
, it will be re
q
sit
at you should specify
to me w
ch
pointes you would have changed of your former
agreement, w
t
allegation of
e reasons
at doe move you
thereunto: and also signifie distinctly, in w
at
sort you
do reqre
at
e States should proceede in
e mater you
referred to their determination. W
t
all in my c
o
ceat
it were a very fitte course
at
e c
o
panie w
t
a l
re
from
themselves should thancke
e States for their former
frindship and favour, and thereby put them in minde
of their l
re
s and grauntes at your first c
o
ming thither
and adde suche other effectuall mater as may serve
to p
r
pare them to consider of all thinges better: pro-
mising therew
t
all
at at
e day assigned or shortly upon
it, you will send ether fewer or more
sons hither,
as they shall appoint, and desiring therupon to knowe
their pleasure in that behalf. Your l
re
I wil
[l]
deliver and acc
o
panie w
t
suche speeche, as I shall thin
[ke]
most c
o
venient for
e adv
a
cem
t
of your cause.
A
[nd]
so saluting you most hartely I betake you to God.
At
e Hage 29 July 1592.
